body:
I found two different adaptive thermal comfort model equations from de Dear et al's two papers. 1. **Comfort operative temperature = 18.9 + 0.255*[mean outdoor daily effective temperature]** ... from the paper **de Dear, R., & Brager, G. S. (1998). Developing an adaptive model of thermal comfort and preference. ASHRAE Transactions, 104(1), 145-167.**

2. **Tcomf = 0.31*[Ta,out] + 17.8** ... where Tcomf means indoor comfortable temperature, and Ta,out means mean outdoor air temperature, ... from the paper **de Dear, R., & Brager, G. S. (2002). Thermal comfort in naturally ventilated buildings: revisions to ASHRAE Standard 55. Energy and Buildings, 34, 549-561.**

I don't have access to the latest ASHRAE Standard 55-2013 now, so I don't know which one is actually adopted by ASHRAE. So, can anybody know about adaptive thermal comfort model kindly advise? Thank you!
topic: why there are two adaptive thermal comfort model equations?
